Jason_Sellers:
{{Short description|American musician (born 1971)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jason Sellers | image = | birth_name = Jason Dale Sellers | birth_place = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|03|04}} | origin = [[Gilmer, Texas]], United States | instrument = {{Hlist|Vocals|Bass guitar}} | genre = [[country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1997–present | label = [[BNA Records|BNA]] | spouse = {{Marriage|[[Lee Ann Womack]]|1991|1996|end=div}} }} '''Jason Dale Sellers''' (born March 4, 1971) is an American [[country music]] artist. After several years of touring the United States in his family's band, Sellers joined the road band of [[Ricky Skaggs]]. By 1997, he was signed to a recording contract with [[BNA Records]], for whom he recorded two studio albums: 1997's ''[[I'm Your Man (Jason Sellers album)|I'm Your Man]]'' and 1999's ''[[A Matter of Time (Jason Sellers album)|A Matter of Time]]''. These two albums produced five singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' Hot Country Singles & Tracks (now [[Hot Country Songs]]) charts; each album's title track reached Top 40 on that chart. Although he has not recorded any albums since ''A Matter of Time'', Jason has had continued success as a songwriter, with acts such as [[Lonestar]], [[Kenny Chesney]], and [[Montgomery Gentry]] having recorded his songs. In addition, he holds several credits as a session background vocalist. ==Biography== Sellers was born in [[Gilmer, Texas]]. His musical beginnings were as a member of his family's [[gospel music]] group, the Singing Sellers, which toured throughout the [[Western United States]].{{cite web |url=http://www.oldies.com/artist-biography/Jason-Sellers.html |title=Jason Sellers Biography |access-date=2007-05-18 |work=Oldies.com}} Between 1991 and 1996, he was married to [[Lee Ann Womack]],{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc.|year=2008|pages=374|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} with whom he had one daughter, [[Aubrie Sellers|Aubrie Lee Sellers]] (born 1991). Sellers moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], while still in his late teens.{{cite web |url={{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p316270/biography|pure_url=yes}} |title=Jason Sellers biography |access-date=2007-05-18 |last=Phares |first=Heather |work=Allmusic}} He then persuaded [[Vince Gill]] to allow him to play [[bass guitar]] in Gill's road band when the band's regular bassist was unavailable. Gill then recommended Sellers to [[Billy Joe Royal]], in whose band Sellers soon became bassist. Afterward, Sellers moved to [[Ricky Skaggs]]' road band, also becoming a [[songwriter]] and road manager for Skaggs. While with Skaggs, Sellers also worked on his songwriting skills, and had songs recorded by [[Pam Tillis]], [[Lonestar]] and [[Wade Hayes]]. He was signed to [[BNA Records]] in 1997, releasing his debut single "I'm Your Man" this year. This song, which peaked at number 37 on the country charts, was the first of three singles from his debut album, also entitled ''[[I'm Your Man (Jason Sellers album)|I'm Your Man]]''. Also released from it were "That Does It" and "This Small Divide", the latter a duet with [[Martina McBride]]. A second album, ''[[A Matter of Time (Jason Sellers album)|A Matter of Time]]'', produced his highest-charting single in its number 33-peaking title track. One day after the album's release, he exited the label's roster.{{cite web |url=http://www.cmt.com/artists/news/1476888/20030813/sellers_jason.jhtml |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930031042/http://www.cmt.com/artists/news/1476888/20030813/sellers_jason.jhtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=September 30, 2007 |title=Jason Sellers, Label Part Ways |access-date=2007-05-18 |work=[[Country Music Television|CMT]]}} The album's second single ("Can't Help Calling Your Name", previously included on ''I'm Your Man'') peaked at number 64. He co-wrote "There's No Gift" with Australian [[Gina Jeffreys]], which was included on her 1999 christmas album, ''[[Christmas Wish (Gina Jeffreys album)|Christmas Wish]]''. Although he has not released any singles since 2000, he holds several credits as a songwriter and harmony vocalist. Singles that Sellers co-wrote include "[[You Can't Hide Beautiful]]" by [[Aaron Lines]], "I'm a Saint" by [[Mark Chesnutt]], "[[Some People Change (song)|Some People Change]]" by [[Montgomery Gentry]], "The One in the Middle" and "He Hates Me" by [[Sarah Johns]], "If You Didn't Love Me" by [[Phil Stacey]], "[[I Still Miss You]]" by [[Keith Anderson]], "[[Strange (Reba McEntire song)|Strange]]" by [[Reba McEntire]], "[[Don't You Wanna Stay]]" by [[Jason Aldean]] and [[Kelly Clarkson]], "[[I Won't Let Go (Rascal Flatts song)|I Won't Let Go]]" by [[Rascal Flatts]], "[[I Got You (Thompson Square song)|I Got You]]" and "[[If I Didn't Have You (Thompson Square song)|If I Didn't Have You]]" by [[Thompson Square]], "[[Sunny and 75]]" by [[Joe Nichols]], "Wherever Love Goes" by [[Kristy Lee Cook]] with [[Randy Houser]] and "[[Goodnight Kiss]]" by Randy Houser. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:12em;"| Title ! style="width:20em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''[[I'm Your Man (Jason Sellers album)|I'm Your Man]]'' | * Release date: September 30, 1997 * Label: [[BNA Records]] * Format: CD, cassette |- ! scope="row"| ''[[A Matter of Time (Jason Sellers album)|A Matter of Time]]'' | * Release date: September 28, 1999 * Label: BNA Records * Format: CD, cassette |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Single ! colspan="2"| Peak chart

Director |- | 1997 ! scope="row"| "I'm Your Man" | Jim Hershleder |- | 1998 ! scope="row"| "This Small Divide" | chris rogers{{sic}} |- | 1999 ! scope="row"| "A Matter of Time" | Thom Oliphant |} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sellers, Jason}} [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:American country bass guitarists]] [[Category:American country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:American male singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Texas]] [[Category:BNA Records artists]] [[Category:People from Gilmer, Texas]] [[Category:Musicians from Nashville, Tennessee]] [[Category:Singer-songwriters from Tennessee]] [[Category:Guitarists from Tennessee]] [[Category:Guitarists from Texas]] [[Category:American male bass guitarists]] [[Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Country musicians from Texas]] [[Category:Country musicians from Tennessee]] [[Category:21st-century American bass guitarists]] [[Category:21st-century American male singers]]
